definition: talkative/to speak out of turn/to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/rumors fly
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
mouth/beak/nozzle/spout (of teapot etc)/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]
to gossip and meddle/to shoot one's mouth off/talkative

sentences.english: So we're not going to give in-depth commentary on the IE team's decision.
sentences.chinese: 所以我們不會對IE團隊的決定多嘴多舌。
還不夠麼？你這個多嘴多舌的傢伙。

sentences.english: When writing with a computer, you must guard against wordiness.
sentences.chinese: 用電腦寫作時，你千萬不要多嘴。

sentences.english: Do not tell her anything because she's a blabber- mouth.
sentences.chinese: 她是個多嘴多舌的人，別告訴她任何事。

sentences.english: He is a loudmouth who cannot be trusted with secrets.
sentences.chinese: 他是個多嘴多舌的人，不能相信他能爲別人保守祕密。
她的多嘴多舌常常惹他發火。
你親切而有同情心，但是你多嘴多舌的。
他真是個多嘴多舌的人。

sentences.english: Too a lot cooks spoil the broth.
sentences.chinese: 人多嘴雜。廚師多燒壞湯？

sentences.english: He never stopped kibitzing when we played cards.
sentences.chinese: 在我們玩牌時他一直亂出主意，多嘴多舌。

sentences.english: Nobody asked his opinion, so he butted out.
sentences.chinese: 沒人問他的意見，因此他沒多嘴。

sentences.english: The real in us is silent; the acquired is talkative.
sentences.chinese: 我們的真我是沉默的，後天之我卻多嘴多舌。

sentences.english: They think a girl who gossips is a bore .
sentences.chinese: 他們認爲多嘴多舌的女孩特煩人。

sentences.english: We already know what a dog really looks like.
sentences.chinese: 不勞你多嘴，我們早就知道狗是長什麼樣子的。

sentences.english: Only the dumb envy the talkative.
sentences.chinese: 只有啞巴才妒忌多嘴的人。

sentences.english: A stupid fellow is talkative; a wise man is meditative.
sentences.chinese: 愚蠢的跟隨者是多嘴的，智者的緘口少言的。

definition: to gossip and meddle/to shoot one's mouth off/talkative
meddling in other people's business
to interrupt (sb talking)/to butt in/to cut into a conversation
to answer/to respond/to converse
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to have loose lips
incorrect variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
meddlesome/eventful
wordy/talkative
to utter a word/to make a sound/to cheep/to squeak/also pr. [zi1 sheng1]
to get angry
to act tactfully/tactful/discreet
slip of the tongue/indiscretion/to blurt out a secret
to talk nonsense/drivel
to gossip/to argue unnecessarily
lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
